newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: GOLF-CHALMERS EXTENDS HIS LEAD IN QUEENSLAND OPEN.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-CHALMERS EXTENDS HIS LEAD IN QUEENSLAND OPEN.

text.p: Australia's Greg Chalmers shot a five-under-par 67 on Friday to extend his lead to four strokes after the second round of the A$200,000 (US$158,000) Queensland Open.
Chalmers, who fired a 65 at the par-72 Windaroo Country Club Course on Thursday, leads from compatriot David Armstrong and New Zealand's Steve Alker.
Alker carded a three-under 69 to move to 136 alongside Armstrong, who shot a second successive 68.
Defending champion Terry Price of Australia missed the halfway cut after adding a 76 to his first round 77.
